member.summary: AuditLogger provides services for logging the audit related messages. It caches the messages before updating the underlaying thing. It uses asynchronous calls to web services.

member.summary: The default set of audit flags

member.summary: The default set of audit flags

member.summary: The default set of audit flags

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.AifServices.AuditLogger.GetAuditFlag(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves the value for the specified audit flag.
member.returns: flag value (0 = logging off, 1 = logging on

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.AifServices.AuditLogger.SetAuditFlag(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the value for the specified audit flag.
member.param: 0 = turn off logging, 1 = turn on logging

member.name: M:Microsoft.Uii.AifServices.AuditLogger.Log(System.String,Microsoft.Uii.Common.Entities.LogData)
member.summary: Logs the messages to the database using the AuditLog web service asynchronously. Caching done based on the NoCache property. Message will be logged only if GetAuditFlag(auditFlagName) returns non-zero. Use SetAuditFlag(auditFlagName) to set.
member.param: Audit log record where ToString() will be used to extract contents

member.name: P:Microsoft.Uii.AifServices.AuditLogger.CacheMaxSize
member.summary: Maximum size of the the Audit Log cache. Size change will take effect on next Log() call.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Uii.AifServices.AuditLogger.NoCache
member.summary: Indicates whether audit messages to be cached or not. If true, no caching happens and all the messages will be logged immediately. If false, messages are cached and flushed to DB when the cache limit reached or certain events happen such as session close.
